DataElement.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Lesser Previous Longest Diameter Sum Measurement
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the sum of measurements of the smallest previous longest diameters of tumors composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Malignant Neoplasm Lesser Previous Longest Diameter
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the smallest previous longest diameter of a tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Of lower rank, degree, or importance; of reduced size, extent, or degree; more limited in quantity.:Occurring prior to something else.:Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.:Diameter; the length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle and connecting two points on the circumference.

Concepts.definition: Of lower rank, degree, or importance; of reduced size, extent, or degree; more limited in quantity.
Having the greater length of two or the greatest length of several.
The length of a straight line passing through the center of a circle or sphere and connecting two points on the circumference.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: information relating to the sum measurement of a lesions dimension.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: any measurements, including linear dimensions, volume, and weight, of a patient's tumor.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Sum; the final aggregate amount.:Measurement; the size or magnitude of something.

Concepts.definition: Annotation used to indicate the size or magnitude of something that was determined by comparison to a standard.
